name: Comfort Suites Kelowna

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here as my husband had business in Kelowna. We were pleased with the location, which was close to where he was working as well as to lots of restaurants and shopping opportunities. We didn't have time to do anything "touristy"; to be honest, if I were going to Kelowna for a holiday, I'd want to stay somewhere with more character than a chain hotel directly on the highway and in the middle of multiple shopping areas.
reviews.title: good place to stay

reviews.text: For the most part, our stay was comfortable and enjoyable. I would definitely stay at the hotel again--for business reasons--if I got the same good price as I did this time. I have made notes below of some of the things that stood out as excellent or that needed improvement.
reviews.title: An experience Above and Beyond

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking: Adequate, which is good if you have a larger vehicle.
reviews.title: Kelowna Comfort!

reviews.text: Pool: We didn't use the pool, but it appeared that those people using it enjoyed themselves. (It was right near reception, very visible to anyone entering/leaving the hotel). Had it been raining, I would definitely have used the exercise room, which appeared to be adequately equipped.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.text: Breakfast: there was an unusually large variety, mostly traditional North American breakfast items including sweet rolls, toast, waffles, cereal, eggs, sausages/bacon, fruit and a variety of juices and hot beverages. A really nice touch was that they offered bagged breakfasts for people who were leaving before the breakfast room opened at 6:30. For us, having such a good breakfast in the hotel saved a lot of time for my husband and his crew. I don't usually eat that much sugar for breakfast, nor should I be eating gluten, but I don't expect that my dietary requirements would be catered to in a situation like this. Sturdier plastic cutlery would have been nice to have: the forks and knives tended to bend whenever we tried to use them on the food!
reviews.title: Missing?

reviews.text: First, this is definitely a busy family hotel, so if you are looking for a quiet, relaxing place, this is probably not your best bet. If you are okay with busy kids, you will be happy here!
reviews.title: Great for Families

reviews.text: We stayed in two different types of rooms for this stay since the same type was not available for all three of the nights we wanted to stay. The first night we stayed in a two-room suite- it was HUGE, had two bathrooms, a king bed in one room, and a queen and sofa sleeper in the other room. Beds were very comfortable although the lighting in the room was pretty dim.
reviews.title: Very good stay

reviews.text: The next 2 nights we stayed in a one room suite which had a king size bed and a sofa sleeper. It was a bit cozy for 5 people, especially after staying in the bigger room for the first night. The pillows in the room were about half the size of a regular pillow and we requested larger pillows (they had these pillows in the other room we stayed in), but they only brought us more small pillows. I complained about this during the email survey they sent us and was assured by the manager that these small pillows were staring to be replaced with the larger ones.
reviews.title: Great Hotel! Very Busy!

reviews.text: Breakfast was good although it was always very busy so sometimes there was a short wait for hot food- the staff did a pretty good job trying to keep up with the demand.
reviews.title: Great New Hotel

reviews.text: Our kids loved the indoor pool and water slide! The pool was pretty busy in the mornings and evenings but was pretty mellow during the afternoons.
reviews.title: Best hotel in Kelowna
A great place to stay in Kelowna
reviews.text: We travel, working, in BC, AB and SK and Comfort Suites in Kelowna is one of the best places we stay. Lee and the rest of the staff at the front desk provide excellent, personal service. The hotel is modern and clean with everything we look for in amenities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I assume the 4 small pillows on each bed are a decorator's touch, but they are horrible to sleep with. One pillow being the size of your head! The air conditioner was LOUD, clicked off and on all night long waking up up with each click. When I complained to the front desk on checkout, I got the usual service reply of these days " I am so sorry to hear that". That will be $150 please. We had planned to stay another night, but fatigue has driven us to the new Four Points....less $$ and much nicer ( and REGULAR pillows). The free breakfast was your usual continental fare...we passed on that. We won't be back.
reviews.title: Pillows and air conditioner

reviews.text: As previous reviewers have mentioned, this is a great hotel. Clean, comfortable and very welcoming. Clearly staff work hard to please. Rooms are large with comfortable beds and the little extras in the rooms, microwave, fridge, etc make for a more enjoyable stay. What can I say, definitely worth booking. Well done to Lee and the rest of the very hard working guys!
reviews.title: comfortable, friendly, good value hotel.
My New Favorite Kelowna Hotel
reviews.text: After a long day working I arrived at the hotel around 9:30 at night. I was greeted by a very happy, and welcoming woman at the front desk. She informed me that I had been given a complimentary upgrade to a king suite with a jetted tub. As a Choice privileges member, she also presented me a goodie bag.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location and has lots of parking. It has a good pool for the kids and a hot tub. As well there is a small fitness room that is open 24/7. Although it is close to the main road, noise was not an issue at all.
reviews.title: Comfortable Bed with a great breakfast

reviews.text: Managed to snag a room for $99. Very nice hotel, with nice rooms and a pool.
reviews.title: Too much styrofoam in the restaurant!

reviews.text: The GM was very nice and friendly; she was genuinely interested in our stay. She even remembered us from check-in when we were checking-out, which shows she really cares for her guests!
reviews.title: Family/Golf Trip to Kelowna
Lovely
reviews.text: The mattress wasn't to my liking (but my travel companions liked it!). The pillows are oddly the size of a half pillow.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downside is the free hot breakfast. Sure, it's free, but the egg patties and sausage were a little suspect and not the best. Won't complain too much because they were free, though ;)
reviews.title: Good place to stay

reviews.text: One thing that I'd like to see is the Styrofoam plates, cups and plastic cutlery get changed to something better for the environment (or switch to real plates, cups and cutlery).
reviews.title: just lovely!

description: One of Kelowna's Newest Hotels! The Comfort Suites offers gold award winning guest services and spacious contemporary decor. All suite hotel with FREE hot breakfast, indoor waterslide and splash pool, FREE wireless internet, cardio and business centre. Collect reward points for more free stays! Top awards for Trip Advisor in Kelowna and top 15 in Canada for Trip Advisor. Great Place to Stay:Great Rooms & Great Staff. - Comfort Suites Your Central Location to Kelowna and Okanagan Valley. Ski, Golf, Wine Business - Enjoy your time at the Comfort Suites.
